titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Webb-Prentis Family Papers
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections
The University of Virginia Library 4136
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Webb-Prentis Family Papers 1770-1908

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Webb-Prentis Family Papers, Accession #4136, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Family papers of the Webb-Prentis families and numerous other Virginians including: correspondence, business papers, legal papers, Nansemond County, Va. papers, genealogy, miscellaneous papers, bound volumes including accounts, legal, medical, memorandum, drawings, oversize items, and lecture notebooks and transcripts.
The collection has sections devoted to Joseph Prentis, Sr. and family; Joseph Prentis, Jr. and family; Prentis family; Allen and Darden Families and miscellaneous correspondence.
The collection contains a document appointing Joseph Prentis as Inspector of Revenue for the Port of Suffolk, 1825 March 17, signed by John Quincy Adams.
Also of interest is a floor plan, 1800 Nov. 12, for "Chaumiere des Praries" a log house in Jessamine County, Ky.
